summary: interferon-induced transmembrane protein 3 (IFITM3)3 belongs to the CD225 gene family. they are highly inducible by both type I (IFN-/IFN-) and II (IFN-) interferons. IFITM3 plays a fundamental role in protecting the host against morbidity and mortality due to infection. lysine methylation may affect non-histone proteins, including viral effectors. there have yet to be any reports that indicate a role for lysine methylation in controlling the activity of antiviral host restriction factors. a PTM enzyme has been identified that targets IFITM3. plasmids del8.9 and VSV-G were gifts from Ke Lan. anti-HA (F-7, Santa Cruz Biotechnology), anti-FLAG (M2, Sigma-Aldrich), anti-calnexin (H-70, Santa Cruz Biotechnology), anti-SET7 (Cell Signaling), anti-IFITM3 (Protein Tech Group, Inc.), anti-histone 3 (Cell Signaling), anti-H3K4me1 (D1A the supernatants were incubated with rabbit IgG-agarose (A2909, Sigma) the IgG-agarose was then resuspended in tobacco etch virus cleavage buffer (10 ml Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 150 mm NaCl, 0.5 mm EDTA, 0.1% (v/v) Nonidet P-40, and 1 mm DTT) at 4 °C overnight. HEK-293T cells expressing HA-IFITM3 were selected using puromycin. cDNA was synthesized using a reverse transcriptase kit (TaKaRa) cDNA samples were then used as templates (25 ng/well) in a 384-well plate and run in triplicate. IAV Production and Infection Recombinant viruses were generated by plasmid-based reverse genetics followed by two-round plaque purification and propagation in MDCK cells. supernatant was then transferred onto HEK-293T cells 72 h post transfection. shRNA Lentivirus Packaging and Transduction Oligonucleotides were generated at Shanghai Sunny Biotechnology Co., Ltd. of the shRNA sequences. 12.5 g of plasmids pLKO.1-shCK, pLKO.1-shSET7, or pLKO.1-shIFITM were co-transfected with 11.125 g of del8.9 and 1.375 g of VSV-G into 1.2 cells were lysed using radioimmune precipitation assay buffer for 1 h on ice. then precleared with protein A/G-Sepharose for 30 min at 4 °C. supernatants were transferred to a new tube and incubated with 2 g of anti-IFITM3 antibody overnight at 4 °C. shRNA expressing vector pLKO.1 was purchased from Open Biosystems. his-tagged (pET-28a) and GST-tagged (pGEX-4T1) plasmids used for production of recombinant proteins in Escherichia coli. lysed in lysis buffer (10 mm Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 150 mm NaCl, 0.5% (v/v) Nonidet P-40, protease inhibitors (Roche Applied Science), 1 mm PMSF. the supernatants were harvested for second affinity purification. HEK-293T cells expressing HA-IFITM3 were selected using puromycin. cDNA was synthesized using a reverse transcriptase kit (TaKaRa) cDNA samples were then used as templates (25 ng/well) in a 384-well plate and run in triplicate. recombinant SET7 or SET7-H297A were expressed in BL21/pLysS cells. proteins were quantified by SDS-PAGE using BSA as a standard. supernatants were immunoprecipitated with antibodies on protein A/G-agarose beads for 1 h at 4 °C. immunocomplexes were then washed with radioimmune precipitation assay buffer four times and examined with Western blotting. dilution assay was used to quantify VSV titers with log dilutions on 100% confluent Vero cells plated in 96-well plates. plasmid-based reverse genetics followed by two-round plaque purification and propagation in MDCK cells as described previously (26). shRNA Lentivirus Packaging and Transduction Oligonucleotides were generated at Shanghai Sunny Biotechnology Co., Ltd. of the shRNA sequences. 12.5 g of plasmids pLKO.1-shCK, pLKO.1-shSET7, or pLKO.1-shIFITM were co-transfected with 11.125 g of del8.9 and 1.375 g of VSV-G into 1.2 endogenous Immunoprecipitation MEF cells were seeded onto six-well plates. 20 h later, cells were pretreated with IFN- for 24 h and then treated with VSV or IFN- for another 6 h. supernatants were then transferred to a new tube and incubated with 2 g of anti-IFITM3 antibody overnight at 4 °C. SET7-H297A (23) and IFITM3-K88R and K88A mutants were generated using the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit (Stratagene) the shRNA expressing vector pLKO.1 was purchased from Open Biosystems and modified for insertion of custom-made shRNAs. ly expressing TAP (2 protein A and a calmodulin binding protein linked by a tobacco etch virus protease cleavage site) or TAP-tagged IFITM3 were harvested and washed with PBS, and then lysed in lysis buffer (10 mm Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 150 mm NaCl, 0.5% (v/v) Nonidet P-40, protease inhibitors. HEK-293T cells were cultured in DMEM containing 10% (v/v) FBS, 50 units/ml of penicillin and 50 g/ml of streptomycin at 37 °C, 5% CO2 in a humidified incubator. cDNA was synthesized using a reverse transcriptase kit (TaKaRa) following manufacturer's instructions. in vitro methylation assays were performed in a 30-l reaction volume. recombinant SET7 or SET7-H297A were expressed in BL21/pLysS cells. Western Blotting and Immunoprecipitation Cells were harvested and washed with ice-cold PBS and lysed on ice for 30 min in 1 radioimmune precipitation assay buffer containing 50 mm Tris/HCl, pH 7.4, 150 mm NaCl, 1% (v/v) Triton X-100, 0.5% (v/v) sodium deoxycholate, 0.1% (v/v) SDS, 1 mm EDTA, supernatant was collected after centrifugation and then filtered through a 0.45-m filter (Millipore) 48 h later, supernatant was collected after centrifugation and then filtered through a 0.45-m filter. supernatant was then filtered through a 0.45-m filter and stored at 80 °C. incubation at 37 °C in 5% CO2 was removed and 2 ml of Avicel medium was added. cells were incubated for a further 3 days and then fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde. 106 MEF cells infected with GFP-VSV at a MOI of 5 for 8 h were resuspended in FACS buffer. endogenous Immunoprecipitation MEF cells were seeded onto six-well plates. 20 h later, cells were pretreated with IFN- for 24 h and then treated with VSV or IFN- for another 6 h. SET7-H297A (23) and IFITM3-K88R and K88A mutants were generated using the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit. the shRNA expressing vector pLKO.1 was purchased from Open Biosystems and modified for insertion of custom-made shRNAs. the supernatants were harvested for second affinity purification. the supernatants were incubated with rabbit IgG-agarose (A2909, Sigma) the supernatants were cleaved by TEV protease. cDNA was synthesized using a reverse transcriptase kit (TaKaRa) cDNA samples were then used as templates (25 ng/well) in a 384-well plate. real-time PCR was carried out on the Prism 7500 Fast System Sequence Detection System (Applied Biosystems) GST, GST-IFITM3, His-SET7, or His-SET7-H297A were expressed in BL21/pLysS cells and purified using glutathione-Sepharose 4B. after dialysis, proteins were quantified by SDS-PAGE using BSA as a standard. Western blotting and immunoprecipitation Cells were harvested and washed with ice-cold PBS and lysed on ice for 30 min in 1 radioimmune precipitation assay buffer. immunocomplexes were then washed with radioimmune precipitation assay buffer four times and examined with Western blotting. VSV expressing green fluorescent protein (VSV-GFP) (25) was propagated in vero cells after infection at a MOI of 0.01. 48 h later, supernatant was collected after centrifugation and then filtered through a 0.45-m filter. supernatant was then transferred onto MDCK cells 72 h post transfection. monolayers of MDCK cells in 12-well plates were infected with 20–40 pfu per well. after a 1-h incubation at 37 °C in 5% CO2, the medium was removed. cells were incubated for a further 3 days and then fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde. CAT (shIFITM); GCAAACTGGCTACCCTTATGT (shSET7–1); and GGGAGTTTACACTTACGAAGA (shSET7–2). GFP-VSV MEF Cell Sorting 2 106 MEF cells infected with GFP-VSV at a MOI of 5 for 8 h were resuspended in FACS buffer (1 mm EDTA, 25 mm HEPES (pH 7.0) FITM3 using the TAP approach (29) to identify novel binding partners and putative regulators of IFITM3. mass spectrometric analysis of purified products revealed high association of IFITM3 with candidate proteins. however, most surprisingly, we detected that Lys-88 of IFITM3 (IFITM3-K88) was subject to monomethylation (IFITM3-K88me1). immunoprecipitation was performed with 1 g of anti-HA or anti-FLAG antibodies plus protein A/G beads. protein blots were probed with antibodies as indicated. HA-tagged IFITM3 and FLAG-tagged SET7, SET8, or SUV39H1 were overexpressed in HEK-293T cells followed by co-immunoprecipitation using anti-FLAG antibody. an increase in signal was detected relative to the FLAG-only control that represented the successful pulldown. HEK-293T cells overexpressing IFITM3, IFITM3-K88me1 levels increased over time after VSV infection, which coincided with an increase in VSV RNA levels (VSV-L), but no change in total IFITM3 protein expression. both viral and host signals may influence the monomethylation of IFITM3 at the posttranslational level. HEK-293T cells grown in six-well plates were transfected with 0.5 g of HA-IFITM3 and 1 g of FLAG-SET7. cells were then immunoprecipitated with 1 g of anti-IFITM3 antibody plus protein A/G beads. GFP-VSV negative and positive cells were sorted (labeled “” and “+” respectively) and analyzed for IFITM3-K88me1 expression by Western blotting. numbers below the IFITM3-K88me1 and IFITM3 bands represent their relative density normalized to the controls. endogenous pulldown of SET7 was confirmed by endogenous IFITM3 in MEF cells infected or treated either with VSV or IFN- for 6 h. the interaction between SET7 and IFITM3 was up-regulated upon VSV infection but reduced with IFN- treatment. we tested levels of IFITM3 and IFITM3-K88me1 by Western blotting in the GFP and GFP+ populations. in HEK-293T cells overexpressing HA-IFITM3, VSV infection increased IFITM3-K88me1 levels over time. however, both the IFITM3-K88me1 signal and VSV RNA levels were effectively reduced upon depletion of SET7. SET7 affects VSV infection only in the presence of IFITM3 expression. HEK-293T cells grown in 12-well plates were transfected with 1 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3 and 1 g of FLAG-SET7 plasmids as indicated. overexpression of SET7 reduced antiviral activity in a dose/IFITM3-dependent manner. in the absence of ectopically expressed IFITM3, levels of VSV infection did not change. cDNA3.1-IFITM3-K88R/K88A mutants and increasing amounts of FLAG-SET7 plasmids (0.3 g, 0.9 g, or 1.5 g) 48 h later, cells were infected with VSV at a MOI of 0.02. cells were collected and tested by Western blotting with the indicated antibodies. the effect of SET7 on ISG-mediated antiviral function was effectively abolished when IFITM1–3 were depleted. the effects of depleting SET7 and/or the IFITMs were also seen via a virus titration assay. SET7 inhibits anti-VSV potency of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. MRC5 cells were tested for knockdown of IFITM1, -2, and -3. knockdown of SET7 promotes antiviral activity of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. SET7 inhibits anti-IAV potency of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. lentivirus-packaged shRNAs were transduced into a549 cells grown in six-well plates. 24 h later, 5 105 cells were counted and transferred to 12-well plates. HEK-293T cells grown in six-well plates with 0.5 g of HA-tagged IFITM3 were co-transfected. protein blots were probed with antibodies as indicated. HA-tagged IFITM3 and FLAG-tagged SET7 were overexpressed in HEK-293T cells followed by co-immunoprecipitation using anti-FLAG antibody. an increase in signal was detected relative to the FLAG-only control that represented the successful pulldown. we further showed the specificity of K88me1 in detecting SET7-mediated monomethylation of IFITM3 at Lys-88. the results showed the specificity of K88me1 in detecting SET7-mediated monomethylation of IFITM3. in HEK-293T cells overexpressing IFITM3, IFITM3-K88me1 levels increased over time after VSV infection. T cells followed by treatment with VSV or IFN- revealed how VSV infection increased the interaction between IFITM3 and SET7. this phenomenon was confirmed by endogenous pulldown of SET7 by endogenous IFITM3 in MEF cells infected or treated either with VSV or IFN-. this phenomenon was confirmed by endogenous pulldown of SET7 by endogenous IFITM3 in MEF cells infected or treated either with VSV or IFN-. HEK-293T cells with low basal levels of endogenous IFITM3 were depleted. the depletion of SET7 had no effect on the levels of viral RNA detected by qPCR after infection. the effect of SET7 on antiviral responses was dependent on the expression of IFITM3. HEK-293T cells were transfected with 1 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3 and 1 g of FLAG-SET7 plasmids as indicated. overexpression of SET7 reduces the antiviral activity of IFITM3. -293T cells grown in 12-well plates were transfected with 0.5 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3 or 0.5 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3-K88R/K88A mutants. cells were infected with VSV at a MOI of 0.02 and collected for analyses 12 h post-infection. SET7 Modulates ISG-mediated Anti-VSV/IAV Responses in an IFITM-dependent FITM1 and IFITM2 were all simultaneously depleted. the effect of SET7 on ISG-mediated antiviral function was effectively abolished. SET7 seemed to not affect antiviral responses when ISGs were not induced, suggesting that at least in this system SET7 does not regulate antiviral responses of low/basal levels of IFITM3. MRC5 cells were tested for knockdown of IFITM1, -2, and -3. knockdown of SET7 promotes antiviral activity of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. lentivirus-packaged shRNAs were transduced into MRC5 cells grown in six-well plates on day 1. knockdown of SET7 no longer had an effect on the levels of WSN33 RNAs detected in the A549 cells. results indicate how the IFITM antiviral factors may be modulated in a SET7-depdendent manner to determine host susceptibility toward viral infection. d, knockdown of SET7 promotes antiviral activity of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. HA-tagged IFITM3 and FLAG-tagged SET7 were overexpressed in HEK-293T cells followed by co-immunoprecipitation using anti-FLAG antibody. or IFITM3 containing a point mutation at Lys-88 to alanine were used. we further showed the specificity of K88me1 toward IFITM3 via an in vitro cell-free methylation reaction with purified recombinant GST-IFITM3 and His-SET7 in the presence of S-adenosylmethionine. these results showed the specificity of K88me1 in detecting SET7-mediated monomethylation of HEK-293T cells overexpressing IFITM3 grown in 12-well plates were infected with VSV at a MOI of 0.02 and treated with IFN- (100 units/ml) cells were collected at the indicated time points post-infection or treatment for immunoblotting with the indicated antibodies. 2 106 MEF cells were pretreated with IFN- (100 units/ml) for 24 h. then infected with GFP-VSV at a MOI of 1 followed by downstream experiments 8 h post-infection. HEK-293T cells with low basal levels of endogenous IFITM3 were infected with VSV. after 12 h, expression levels of VSV-L and VSV-P RNA were detected. no changes in the susceptibility of SET7-depleted cells toward viral infection. the overexpression of SET7 in HEK-293T cells reduced antiviral activity in a dose/IFITM3-dependent manner. in the absence of ectopically expressed IFITM3, the levels of VSV infection did not change. a, overexpression of SET7 reduces the antiviral activity of IFITM3. SET7 Regulates monomethylation of IFITM3 at Lys-88. blot analysis revealed high association of IFITM3 with candidate proteins. lysine methyltransferases SET7, SET8, and SUV39H1 were cloned. 1 g of FLAG-tagged SET7, SET8 or SUV39H1 were co-transfected into HEK-293T cells grown in six-well plates with 0.5 g of HA-tagged IFITM3. immunoprecipitation was performed with 1 g of anti-HA or anti-FLAG antibodies plus protein A/G beads. in vitro methylation was performed with S-adenosylmethionine (SAM), recombinant His-SET7, His-SET7-DN, and GST-IFITM3 as indicated. immunoblotting and Coomassie Brilliant Blue staining were used to show methylation and protein levels. we further showed the specificity of K88me1 toward IFITM3 via an in vitro cell-free methylation reaction with purified recombinant GST-IFITM3 and His-SET7. these results showed the specificity of K88me1 in detecting SET7-mediated monomethylation of IFITM3 at Lys-88. HEK-293T cells were transfected with 1 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3 and 1 g of FLAG-SET7 plasmids as indicated. 48 h later, cells were infected with VSV at a MOI of 0.02 and analyzed 12 h post-infection. HEK-293T cells grown in 12-well plates were transfected with 0.5 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3 or 0.5 g of pcDNA3.1-IFITM3-K88R/K88A mutants. cells were then collected and tested by Western blotting with the indicated antibodies (bottom) or subjected to qPCR analysis for VSV-P and VSV-L expression (top) IFN- may up-regulate a host of ISGs, including IFITM1, 2, and 3 (IFITM1–3). we found that SET7 could also interact with IFITM1 and IFITM2. signals were detected using the K88me1 antibody that indicated the presence of monomethylation on IFITM1 and IFITM2. IFITM2 can interact with SET7 and are sensitive to SET7-mediated monomethylation. 1 g of FLAG-tagged SET7 was co-transfected into HEK-293T cells. MRC5 cells were tested for knockdown of IFITM1, -2, and -3. SET7 inhibits anti-IAV potency of ISGs in an IFITM-dependent manner. lentivirus-packaged shRNAs were transduced into a549 cells grown in six-well plates on day 1. after lentivirus infection for 12 h, the medium was changed to fresh DMEM. treatment for 24 h, infected cells with WSN33 at a MOI of 2 and collected 24 h post-infection for quantitative PCR (top) or Western blot analysis with the indicated antibodies. lysine monomethylation of IFITM3 at Lys-88 is positively regulated by viral infection/SET7 and negatively regulated by type I IFN. we did not detect any differences in localization between WT IFITM3 and its K88R or K88A mutants, even in the presence of ectopically expressed SET7 to drive increased monomethylation of IFITM3. both of the K88R and K88A mutants of IFITM3 have a mild or at least a slightly negative effect on its antiviral function. however, in the same study, the activity of the IFITM3-K88A mutant had monomethylation of IFITM3 may affect its direct binding to other cofactors. the interaction between IFITM3 and VAPA does not change upon monomethylation of IFITM3. however, the changes in interaction between IFITM3 and other potentially unknown molecules in the presence or absence of SET7-mediated monomethylation are currently being explored.
